|dykdate=28 June 2011 |dykentry=... that the [[Allies of World War II|Second World War Allies]] feared that [[Nazi Germany]] intended to use a '''[[La Coupole|secret underground rocket base]]''' in France to fire ballistic missiles ''([[V-2]] pictured)'' at New York City? |topic=War |currentstatus=FA |four=no |maindate=March 25, 2013 }} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject France|class=FA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Germany|class=FA|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Military history|class=FA|French=yes|German=yes|WWII=yes|Fortifications=yes}} {{WikiProject Rocketry}} }}
==WP:MILHIST Assessment== It might be useful to add [[Template:Infobox Military Structure]]. [[User:LordAmeth|LordAmeth]] 08:59, 10 November 2006 (UTC)
== WikiProject Military history/Assessment/Tag & Assess 2008 == Article reassessed and graded as start class. --[[User:Dashiellx|dashiellx]] ([[User talk:Dashiellx|talk]]) 18:43, 12 June 2008 (UTC)
==Bombing== I always thought that the British dropped tall boy bombs around the site to cause an 'earthquake' effect knocking the site out of alignment or somehting, it was in a BBC documentary but I can't remember any details. ([[User:Fdsdh1|Fdsdh1]] ([[User talk:Fdsdh1|talk]]) 17:44, 8 July 2012 (UTC))
==Museum status?== I wonder if we could update this article to show/emphasise that there is actually a museum there (and describe its exhibits if possible)? The official website is [http://www.lacoupole-france.com/ here]. Merci! [[User:Nimbus227|Nimbus]] [[User talk:Nimbus227|<font style="color:#2F4F4F;">(Cumulus <font style="color:#708090;">nimbus <font style="color:#D3D3D3;">floats by)</font></font></font>]] 11:40, 19 November 2010 (UTC) :I've now done just that, in the course of rewriting this article. If you feel the deletion can be contested then please do so ([[commons:COM:SPEEDY]] has further information). Otherwise consider finding a replacement image before deletion occurs.
